<SID:Element ns="Base" tag="Container" recpoint="false" transient="false" comment="These are the physical container values for an object -- (See Buiders TWiki BulkSystem for documentation)">
<SID:Attribute id="capacity" atype="lpc_flt" acomment="How much volume can this container hold?
Values are in cubic meters (m^3)
(1 cubic meter = 1000 liters = 264.2 gallons = ~five 55-gallon drums = ~1 long ton of water = 1.3 cubic yards = 35.31 cubic feet = 61,015 cubic inches)
(1 cubic foot = ~0.03 m^3; 6x6x6 inches = ~0.004 m^3; 1 gallon of water = ~0.004 m^3; 1 liter is 0.001 m^3; 1 cubic inch = ~0.0004 m^3)
(10x10x10 foot room = 28.3 m^3)
(See Buiders TWiki ContainerValues for more example values)" areadonly="false" aquery="query_intrinsic_capacity"/> <SID:Attribute id="maxweight" atype="lpc_flt" acomment="What is max mass that the container can hold?
Values are in kilograms (kg), note that this value includes the mass of the container itself, so if this is a container this value must be larger then Base:Mass.
(1 kg = 1000 grams = ~2.2 pounds = ~35 ounces)
(1 kg = mass of 1 liter of water = ~2.2 pints of water, ~weight of a 5cm (~1 inch) cube of steel)
(.025 kg = 2.5 grams = weight of a silver dime)
(10x10x10 foot room = 28.3 m^3 = 28,300 kg of water)
(See Buiders TWiki ContainerValues for more example values)" areadonly="false" aquery="query_max_weight"/>
